text: Austroargiolestes amabilis is a species of Australian damselfly in the family Megapodagrionidae, commonly known as a flame flatwing. It is endemic to eastern Australia, where it inhabits streams in rainforest. Austroargiolestes amabilis is a medium-sized to large, black and bright yellow-orange damselfly, without pruinescence. Like other members of the family Megapodagrionidae, it rests with its wings outspread. ==Gallery== Austroargiolestes amabilis female (11775541204).jpg | Tip of female tail Austroargiolestes amabilis male (11775912116).jpg | Tip of male tail Austroargiolestes amabilis female wings (34441691040).jpg | Female wings Austroargiolestes amabilis male wings (34695565141).jpg | Male wings ==See also== * List of Odonata species of Australia == References == Category:Megapodagrionidae Category:Odonata of Australia Category:Insects of Australia Category:Endemic fauna of Australia Category:Taxa named by Friedrich Förster Category:Insects described in 1899 Category:Damselflies
title: Austroargiolestes amabilis
